subject: Science
title: Biogeography: Location Tells the Story
description: Learn Biogeography: Location Tells the Story in one minute.

hook.text: Why does Australia have kangaroos but Africa doesn't? The answer is evolution plus geography.

buildup.text: Species on islands and isolated continents evolve differently from their mainland relatives.

discovery.text: Australia's marsupials evolved in isolation for 30 million years after it split from other continents.

twist.text: Hawaii has no native land mammals, reptiles, or amphibians â€” only what could fly or float there.

climax.text: If species were created in place, island patterns make no sense. With evolution, they make perfect sense.

punchline.text: Where species live tells you where they evolved. Geography is biology's autobiography.

quiz.question: Why does Australia have unique marsupials?
options: They evolved in isolation after the continent separated
They were introduced by early humans
